Dear Ms. Westphal:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
01/23/2019. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted three acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
Special investigation #2018C0201014 was initiated on 01/26/2018. The facility was
found in noncompliance with rule 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
development of plan required. The facility submitted an acceptable corrective action
plan. The plan has been followed as no repeat violation has occurred.
Special investigation #2018C0201025 was initiated on 03/14/2018. The facility was in
non-compliance with rule 400.4158 Discipline. The facility submitted an acceptable
corrective action plan. The plan has been followed as no repeat violation has
occurred.
Special investigation #2018C0201034 was initiated on 05/11/2018. The facility was
found in non-compliance with rule 400.4149 Resident nutrition. The facility submitted
an acceptable corrective action plan. The plan has been followed as no repeat
violation has occurred.
2

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Macomb County Juvenile
Justice Center continue on their regular license.
